article_title: Police arrest two dozen sitting in street during casino union protest
article_text:
54 PROTEST Local 54 members get arrested during the protest at intersection of Arctic Ave and Christopher Columbus Blvd and the Expressway an alleged attempt by "the industry" to take away members' healthcare Wednesday, Oct 8, 2014. The event is styled as a celebration of the 10-year anniversary of a strike over healthcare.

Local 54 Casino workers gather for a protest Wednesday in Atlantic City.

Local54 4.jpg

Local54 5.jpg

Local 54 2.jpg Atlantic City Police Lt. James Sarkos warns UNITE-HERE Local 54 protesters they are breaking the law by obstructing a public passage.

Local54 3.jpg

54 PROTEST Local 54 members protest at intersection of Arctic Ave and Christopher Columbus Blvd and the Expressway an alleged attempt by "the industry" to take away members' healthcare Wednesday, Oct 8, 2014. The event is styled as a celebration of the 10-year anniversary of a strike over healthcare.

og.description: ATLANTIC CITY — Two dozen people were taken into custody Wednesday for sitting in the middle of the intersection of Arkansas and Arctic Avenues to protest casinos threatening to take away workers’ benefits.
